questions.question_text:
Review the screenshot below. Which statement is correct about the information it contains?

//IMG//

An administrator wants to enable users to access retail websites that are considered minimum risk.

Which two URL categories should be combined in a custom URL category to accomplish this goal? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
CD is correct

Selected Answer: CD
e-commerce and known-good are not valid categories according to the FW. Can only be CD

Selected Answer: CD
checked in fw

Selected Answer: CD
Those are the right categories.

Selected Answer: CD
CD - Checked on FW 
Objects -> Security Profiles -> URL Filtering -> Categories

CDE - C. It simplifies user administration. Defining policy rules based on user group membership rather than individual users simplifies administration because you don’t have to update the rules whenever group membership changes1.

D. It automatically adds new users to the appropriate group. User-to-group mapping can handle very large Active Directory environments, and it’s scalable2. This implies that as new users are added to the system, they can be automatically mapped to the appropriate groups based on their attributes.

E. It allows an administrator to write more granular policies. By mapping users to groups, administrators can write policies that are more specific to the needs and permissions of each group1.

Selected Answer: ACD
A. It does not require additional objects to be configured.
C. It simplifies user administration.
D. It automatically adds new users to the appropriate group.

Selected Answer: ACD
B.it requires a server profile.
E. it`s actually more general rules (if you only have users then you need to add the users to the rule - that is more granular).

Selected Answer: CDE
A is not correct. Group－Mapping needs LDAP server profile.

comments.content: LDAP server profile is not an object.

choices.E: It allows an administrator to write more granular policies.
choices.D: It automatically adds new users to the appropriate group.
choices.A: It does not require additional objects to be configured.
choices.B: It does not require a Server profile.

Which situation is recorded as a system log?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Gonna go with A because it seems to be the most accurate. The system log shows a medium event of "auth-server-up" when connectivity to an Auth server such as TACACS+ is restored.
A seems correct as the information closely pertains to "high" severity log type compared to the other 3 options

choices.C: An attempt to access a spoofed website has been blocked.

choices.B: A file that has been analyzed is potentially dangerous for the system.

D is the answer
